I don't think Steam gives refunds so I guess that's $10 down the drain.

Half - Life....
 Начало грандиозной и известной на весь мир серии. Что можно сказать об игре. Меня она очень порадовала, так как в ней присутствует глубочайшая атмосфера, интересный сюжет и занимающий геймплей. Если вы фанат шутеров и любите подумать над головоломками вы не разочаруетесь в этой игре. Не смотря на то, что игра вышла в 1998 году, в 2013 я проходил ее с большим удовольствие и надеюсь, что снова перепройду эту игр ни раз!! Всем рекомендую !

This game came with the valve complete pack I purchased and I have to say, I wasn’t expecting much from Half-Life but it turns out its one of the best games I have played by far! Recommend it to anyone.

This game ranks as one of the all-time great shooters, but there are a few things people new to the series need to know.  This game gets cruelly difficult after awhile during your first playthrough.  Expect to have to quick save a lot and retry areas until you get the right strategy worked out.  Also, if you play on a smaller screen, like a laptop, the crosshairs are somewhat difficult to see.  Still, this is a must get when it's on sale.  It even works well as a drinking game...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XR5T3fBcRGA&feature=youtu.be

Ich kann die viele negative Kritik nicht nachvollziehen. Dieses Spiel, welches glaube ich aus dem Jahr 1998 stammt, hat auch im Jahr 2014 noch seinen Platz. Ja, die Story ist vorhersehbar, viele Rätsel im Grunde bereits bekannt, der lineare Spielaufbau eventuell out of Date, aber das Spiel hat einfach das gewisse Etwas.

Besonders erstaunt mich die für damlige Verhältnisse überragende KI. Gegner gehen in Deckung und versuchen strategisch bessere Positionen einzunehmen. 
Das Leveldesign ist auch super. Fast jeder Schaden in dem Spiel kann vermieden werden und manche Rätsel bieten mehr als nur eine Lösung. 

Einziger Kritikpunkt aus meiner Perspektive: die schwammige Steuerung.

Ansonsten gehört Half Life ähnlich wie Red Faction zu meinen absoluten Klassikern.

"Roger that, let's run like hell."
Oh- you'll run like hell alright, guns blazing!
-10/10

I'd say, this is a real classic and the "holy grail" of FPS. Combined with horror, militia and sci-fi, make your 15 hours of terror remains with marvelous feelings.

Aun me sorprende que haya gente que no conozca una aventura tan Sorprendente y llena de accion como la de Half-Life.
En mi vida escuche a alguien decir "Voy a hacer un juego de disparos, tu arma principal es una palanca y tus enemigos son Alienigenas" y que le salga bien, sin embargo Half-Life me hizo quitarme el gorro y pedir perdon.
Una banda sonora majestual hecha cada una para cada momento de accion en el juego, Jefes increibles que no son de los tipicos "Dispara y Corre" y una historia que sin duda alguna merece esas 50 nominaciones al mejor juego del año.

This is the sort of game that I used to watch my dad play when I was younger. A true classic, but it still may not be for everyone as the game has not aged well, but if you are able to look past this then you are in for an experience. Its a game that you have to play in order to call yourself a true gamer.

Офигительнейшая ностальгия)) Игра пройдена более 10 лет назад, а чувства все теже))) Пожалуй, одна из самых лучших экшенов прошлого тысячелетия)))) Радует что можно играть в OS X без всяких проблем в Full HD разрешении))) В HL Source так и не увидел моделей оружия((( пожалуй, перепройду HL заново))) Всем отличной ностальгии ;)
You get to play as a mute theoretical physicist who wrecks havoc upon firearms specialists, and aliens from an alternative dimension with a crowbar.
It is mind blowing that after 16 years has passed, this game is still extremely entertaining and playable. Way better than any C.O.D. shit.
It a great story even though there was no cinematics and the gameplay was fantasic. I definitively recommend it!

I'm not even very far into this game yet, and there are endless things I could say about it, but I think the fact that someone is still reviewing this game almost 16 years after it was released says enough.

Game:  Half-Life
Genre:  FPS/Horror
Developer:  Valve
System:  Steam (PC)
Total Score: 77/100
Value Score: 7.7/10

• Story:  7/10
• Characters: 7/10
• GamePlay:  10/10	
• Graphics:  8/10
• Sound: 8/10
• Music:  7/10
• Length: 7/10
• Replay Value: 6/10
• Player Value: 7/10

[u]Pros[/u]
+Great environment design and theme
+Great Variety of weapons and the mechanics are nicely done
+Well designed puzzles and scenarios
+Console mode enabled lets you play the game differently than it should (i.e. NoClip, Godmode, etc)
+Multiplayer allows you to do PvP type matches against other players
+Choice of 3 different difficulties

[u]Cons[/u]
-Sometimes certain NPCs that killed make it inaccessible to certain areas unless you use cheats
-The game tends to be glitchy at times such as enemies going through walls, etc (very rare though)
-This is the original - the source edition is considered to be the superior version due to some changes such as the engine, the  sound effects, etc.

I never had the chance to play Half-Life on release and for the last 16 years all I've heard about is how I've missed out on one of the greatest single player games ever created. I thought I'd left it too long and any enjoyment would be sucked out by the sheer age of the game. I picked up the Half-Life collection in the sale and started playing, 10.9 hours later and I can tell you this is definitely still worth playing.
The graphics are outdated, the AI could do with some work, the entire employment force of the black messa research facility consist of 4 scientists and a security guard (not counting a badass theoretical physicist). And still these aspects of the game are unimportant compared to the compelling story arc paired with the unique FPS/Puzzle solving play style.

Think portal without the portals and various military/alien enemies.

I wish I could have played it on release. 8/10.

今更ながら購入し日本語化してプレイ、難易度ノーマル15時間ほどでクリアでした。
日本語化を行うとプレイ時間が記録されないので注意です。
10時間～20時間がプレイ時間でしょうか。
今となっては古めのゲームながらかなり面白かったです。
謎解きをする要素はなく、基本的に1本道ですが、突然現れる敵や、ギミックなど、飽きさせない演出が良くできていると思いました。
また飛び石のようなところをジャンプで抜けたり、アクション要素も強かったと思います。
やりづらかった点としては、マップ移動のローディングが挟まるとたまに地形にスタックしてしまったり、変なところに引っかかってロードしざるを得なくなったりということがありましたが、オートセーブ箇所は沢山あり、自分でもセーブがどこでもできるため、ほとんど気になりませんでした。

昨今のFPSしかやったことがない方、ぜひ一度触れてみてほしいゲームだなと思いました。
近接武器の高速殴りは必見です！

Half-Life-игра высшего класса!

Esse jogo não te oferece risco algum de decepção. Um clássico, uma marca, um pilar dos jogos, um divisor de águas. Isso que Half-Life é.

断断续续玩了一个礼拜，终于通关了（游戏流程怎么这么长！）。说真的，辛苦那么久，等通关后的，就是黑屏吗！？还是我卡bug了！制作人员的名单都没出来！罢了罢了，没精力玩二周目了~作为一个九八年的游戏，能把怪设计成这么恶心，也是醉了，尤其是最后个BOSS。并且时不时冲出来一个，简直吓尿。在这部作品很多细节方面，能让我看到阀门公司的特点，到现在的传送门上依旧能看到。总之呢，这是个十分精彩的游戏，慢慢玩，能玩出里面的味道。

Anywho this game is really cool and really awesome if you can handle that graphics and character models on the game.(I mean it came out during the 90's what did you expect!)
Plot: 10000/10

I would recommend this game to anyone who is into Action Sci-Fi Adventures! :D

The FPS game. The game that defined a genre 15 years ago. Now with widescreen support, vsync option and hi-res texture pack! No, not HD texture pack, just high-res (released quite long ago so the game still looks dated).

Why do we like Half Life? Because you play an average guy, a scientist, not some spec-ops sir-yes-sir veteran, just one of the common people who finds himself in the middle of a catastrophe and the only way to get out of it is to shoot up some aliens. Oh, and while there, why not go to their planet to blow up the very alien controlling all of them?

I believe this was the game that gave birth to scripted events, or at least made them look very good.

It is an action-packed, amazing game - with some puzzle sequences here and there - that offers roughly 10-15 hours of single player time, if not more. Nowadays, this is very rare.
Legendary masterpiece of FPS games

Half Life is a game most people have probably played in their lives. I've played bits of it as a kid, but I think I found it to scary so I never played it properly back then. Over the time I just never really cared for it so I didn't play it.

Thanks to the Valve sales, I decided to buy it and play it.  Considering the low price, it was worth it. 10 hours spent well.

It should be noted that the game was quite innovative for its time, and did a lot for its genre. Playing it now, most of it is lost on you, so you just take it for what it is now. Did it age well? Yes it did, aside from enemies taking too many hits at times and every bullet hitting you for sure. Thanks to Quick Save/Load, that's not a problem, you just avoid taking lots of damage, as you can recover health after every bigger section. So I'd say the action is good and not that much broken. 

However, platforming can be a bit tricky, as the player movement doesn't seem to have been designed for platforming. Kinda like having to jump on platforms in a Call of Duty game. It's just weird, and often you end up missing or jumping on it and falling off. Quick Save/Load fixes this issue as you can just save before tricky jumps. 

Quick Saves. They are your best friend in this game, but at the same time you might hate yourself for using them. They make the game too easy as you can save anywhere and anytime you want. Dangerous enemies in the next room? Quick save. Took out one of the big ones without taking much damage? Quick save and attack the next one.  It just makes the game easier than it should be, so the challenge is kinda low thanks to it. It's basically "legal' save states. Finishing the game without them would be a nice challenge.

Can't talk much about difficulty differences as I played on normal. I don't know how difficult this mode even was, as Quick saves take you right back into the latest action.

The story was more subtle in this game. You are just a scientist that got involved in a mess. Most of the story you hear from other NPCs (you can't pause the game while they are talking, otherwise the audio gets canceled) and observing what's going on.

After 10 hours of fun, I have to say that the ending was really disappointing in my case. It was just a short dialogue with you getting to choose between a good and bad ending. So it's kinda pointless. 

Overall, I'll rate this game 7/10, it's worth giving a try, and the game looks really nice with the HD texture pack.

Spoiler Alert: (This is like the summary of the whole game don't look unless you really want to!!)

[spoiler]Ok so you start out working in a lab, doing what you do best, then all of a sudden there's a Resonance Cascade (huge explosion go boom and aliens and shit pop out of nowhere. Most of the lab (Black Mesa) is destroyed and now there are aliens everywhere.
You then travel throughout the lab to attempt getting to the surface. Shortly you find out that you're now fucking at war against the military, who, wants to destroy you, and everything else relating to the Resonance Cascade. 
You are then set out to find the Lambda Complex which is the last (assuming) funtional site of the Black Mesa complex.
Somewhere halfway through the game you set off a rocket (which I forget the point of. It wasn't explained on after I actually launched it.)
Ok then after you're actually finished underground, you're tasked with crossing the military zone to reach the Lambda Complex. 
Summary: Blow up tanks and helicopters - No one cares about you anymore cause you're killing everyone so they call in an airstrike to destroy everything, including the aliens which still want to kill you.
You go back underground and finally reach Sector F (LC)!!!!
You teleport to the planet Xen (home of the aliens.)
The remaining scientists told you that you need to kill the ruler of Xen to save the world cause obviously you aren't emotionally scarred yet.
Kill Big Momma and then you kill the final boss that looks like a giant fetus (this was the most annoying boss but I was stupid!!)

Finally the game ends and you see G-Man (yes it's that creepy guy that everyone talks about but doesn't know where he came from.) He's really weird and he says his "company has let him offer you a job." 
MEGA SPOILER: Depending on what you do, if you take his offer then you're hired and you await for your new job (probably referring to Half-Life 2), if you reject his offer then he teleports you back to Xen in a pit filled with aliens without weapons (because the bitch took them cause they were "government property") and the game ends. [/spoiler]

What a great game.
